pl.touk.hades
Class HaDataSource<T extends FailoverActivator>

java.lang.Object
  pl.touk.hades.HaDataSource<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Wrapper, CommonDataSource, DataSource, HaDataSourceMBean
Direct Known Subclasses:
LoadHaDataSource
public class HaDataSource<T extends FailoverActivator>
extends Object
implements DataSource, HaDataSourceMBean

A data source which offers high-availability (HA) by enclosing two real data sources - the main one and the failover one. Which enclosed data source is used is not determined by the HA data source itself. It is the responibility of FailoverActivator associated with this HA data source.

This class should be used as follows: 

 DataSource mainDs = new SomeDataSourceImplementation(...);
 DataSource failoverDs = new SomeOtherDataSourceImplementation(...);

 FailoverActivator someImplementationOfFailoverActivator = new LoadFailoverActivator();
 // Additional configuration of the above activator goes here. For example:
 someImplementationOfFailoverActivator.setStatement('select * from SOME_TABLE'));

 HaDataSource haDataSource = new HaDataSource();
 haDataSource.setMainDataSource(mainDs);
 haDataSource.setFailoverDataSource(failoverDs);

 // The following two calls associate the HA data source with the failover activator:
 haDataSource.setFailoverActivator(someImplementationOfFailoverActivator);
 haDataSource.init();

 // The HA data source is ready to be used. Now the activator must be invoked, for
 // example periodicaly in a separate thread, to control the switching between the
 // main and the failover data sources. For example every 20 seconds:
 new Timer().schedule(someImplementationOfFailoverActivator, 0, 20000);

 // Now HA data source is controlled by the activator. If the activator decides that
 // the failover is necessary (because for example mainDs.getConnection() throws an
 // exception) it will silently do it. After the failover, connections from the failover
 // data source are returned. If the activator decides that the failback is possible
 // (because for example mainDs.getConnection() starts to retun connections) it can
 // silently do it. After the failback, connections from the main data source are returned.

 // Here go some operations. As some time passes a failover can be activated
 // (by someImplementationOfFailoverActivator in the above timer thread) if
 // something is wrong with the main data source.
 ...

 conn1 = haDataSource().getConnection(); // conn1 can be a connection from failover data
                                         // source if failover was activated by the above timer
                                         // someImplementationOfFailoverActivator.
 // Here go some operations on conn1.
 ...

 // Here go some operations. As some time passes a failback can be activated
 // (by someImplementationOfFailoverActivator in the above timer thread) if
 // the main data source is back to normal.
 ...

 conn2 = haDataSource().getConnection(); // conn2 can be a connection from main data
                                         // source if failback was activated by
                                         // someImplementationOfFailoverActivator.
 // Here go some operations on conn2.
 ...

Author:
Michal Sokolowski

Constructor Detail

HaDataSource

public HaDataSource()
Method Detail

init

public void init()
Associates the failover activator set by setFailoverActivator(FailoverActivator) with this HA data source. This method simply invokes getFailoverActivator().init(this).

getConnection

public Connection getConnection()
                         throws SQLException
Invokes getConnection() on the main data source or on the failover data source if failover is inactive or active respectively. To check whether failover is active isFailoverActive() on the associated failover activator is invoked.

The above check is ommited if the main data source is pinned (see pinMainDataSource()). In such case connections from the main data source are returned.

The above check is also ommited if the failover data source is pinned (see pinFailoverDataSource()). In such case connections from the failover data source are returned.

Specified by:
getConnection in interface DataSource
Returns:
connection from the main data source if failover is inactive or from the failover data source otherwise
Throws:
SQLException - if getting a connection from one of the two enclosed data sources throws an exception

getConnection

public Connection getConnection(String username,
                                String password)
                         throws SQLException
Invokes getConnection(username, password) on the main data source or on the failover data source if failover is inactive or active respectively. To check whether failover is active isFailoverActive() on the associated failover activator is invoked.

The above check is ommited if the main data source is pinned (see pinMainDataSource()). In such case connections from the main data source are returned.

The above check is also ommited if the failover data source is pinned (see pinFailoverDataSource()). In such case connections from the failover data source are returned.

Specified by:
getConnection in interface DataSource
Parameters:
username - username for which the connection should be returned
password - password for the specified username
Returns:
connection from the main data source if failover is inactive or from the failover data source otherwise
Throws:
SQLException - if getting a connection from one of the two enclosed data sources throws an exception

getConnection

public Connection getConnection(boolean failover,
                                boolean withAuth,
                                String username,
                                String password,
                                String logPrefix)
                         throws SQLException
Delegates to getConnection() (if withAuth is false) or to getConnection(username, password) (if withAuth is true). The time of the above invocation (even if ended with SQLException) is measured and logged in debug mode (the log is prefixed with logPrefix parameter).

This method was created for those failover activators that need to get connections from the main data source and the failover data source to decide whether failover should be active or not.

Parameters:
failover - whether to return a connection from the failover data source or from the main data source
withAuth - whether to delegate to DataSource.getConnection(String, String) or to DataSource.getConnection()
username - username for which the connection should be returned (ignored if withAuth is false)
password - password for the given username (ignored if withAuth is false)
logPrefix - text used as a log prefix
Returns:
connection from the specified data source
Throws:
SQLException - if the specified data source throws the exception

toString

public String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class Object

pinMainDataSource

public void pinMainDataSource()
Pins the main data source. From now on methods getConnection() and getConnection(String, String) will get connections from the main data source.

Specified by:
pinMainDataSource in interface HaDataSourceMBean

pinFailoverDataSource

public void pinFailoverDataSource()
Pins the failover data source. From now on methods getConnection() and getConnection(String, String) will get connections from the failover data source.

Specified by:
pinFailoverDataSource in interface HaDataSourceMBean

removePin

public void removePin()
Removes pin enabled by pinMainDataSource() or pinFailoverDataSource(). From now on methods getConnection() and getConnection(String, String) will ask the failover activator whether failover is active.

Specified by:
removePin in interface HaDataSourceMBean

getPinEnabled

public boolean getPinEnabled()
Returnes true if pin is enabled and false otherwise. The pin can be enabled by pinMainDataSource() or pinFailoverDataSource(). The pin can be disabled by removePin().

Specified by:
getPinEnabled in interface HaDataSourceMBean
Returns:
true if pin is enabled and false otherwise

getFailoverDataSourcePinned

public Boolean getFailoverDataSourcePinned()
Returns the pin status of this HA data source. Pin status is described as follows. If no pin is enabled null is returned. If the main data source is pinned (see pinMainDataSource() true is returned. If the failover data source is pinned (see pinFailoverDataSource() false is returned.

Returns:
the pin status of this HA data source

isFailoverActive

public boolean isFailoverActive()
Returns true if the failover data source is used and false if the main data source is used. The failover data source is used (i.e. getConnection() and getConnection(String, String) returns connections from it) if it is pinned (see pinFailoverDataSource()). Similarly, the main data source is used if it is pinned (see pinMainDataSource()). If no pin is enabled and getFailoverActivator().isFailoverActive() returns false the main data source is used. If no pin is enabled and getFailoverActivator().isFailoverActive() returns true the failover data source is used.

Specified by:
isFailoverActive in interface HaDataSourceMBean
Returns:
true if the failover data source is used, false otherwise

getActiveDataSourceName

public String getActiveDataSourceName()
Returns the name of the currently used data source. The currently used data source is determined as in isFailoverActive(). The main data source name can be set in setMainDataSourceName(String). The failover data source name can be set in setFailoverDataSourceName(String). The default names are defaultMainDataSourceName and defaultFailoverDataSourceName.

Specified by:
getActiveDataSourceName in interface HaDataSourceMBean
Returns:
the name of the currently used data source
